subject: Real Estate
title: The Vacancy Paradox
description: A quick win: understand The Vacancy Paradox.

hook.text: New York has a housing crisis â€” yet over 60,000 apartments sit empty at any given time.

buildup.text: Some are between tenants. Others are held off the market by owners waiting for higher rents.

discovery.text: Luxury units are the worst offenders. Developers would rather keep them empty than lower the price.

twist.text: Lowering rent on one unit resets the building's comparable value, dragging every other unit down.

climax.text: Strategic vacancy is rational for landlords but devastating for a city that needs every unit occupied.

punchline.text: Empty apartments can be more profitable than full ones.

quiz.question: Why do some landlords keep luxury apartments vacant?
options: Lowering rent would depress the building's value
